title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 22.3 - Evidence of literacy
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 22.3 - Evidence of literacy

State Regulations

Certificates of literacy shall be issued as follows: (a) To all applicants who have passed an
examination or test authorized by the commissioner. This test shall be known as
the New York State Regents literacy test. (b) To applicants who because of physical
disability are unable to pass the New York State Regents literacy test but who
can satisfy the examiner that they could pass the test if it were not for such
disability. Upon the issuance of a certificate of literacy in such cases, the
examiner shall write in ink across the face of the certificate of literacy the
words "physically disabled."
Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
